org.smartfrog.sfcore.utils
Class SmartFrogThread

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.smartfrog.sfcore.utils.SmartFrogThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Executable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SFLogStdStreamImpl.StreamGobbler, TerminatorThread, WorkflowThread
public class SmartFrogThread
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Executable

This thread represents the base class for threads run under SmartFrog. It contains extra methods for behaviour we want across all our threads.

  1. A notification is raised after the work is done, on whichever object is the notifyObject. By default, this is the thread itself, though other values may be provided in a constructor.
    2. Any throwable thrown in the execute() method is caught and can be retrieved with the getThrown() method.
To use these features, do not overrride the run() method. Override execute() or pass in a Runnable to the constructor. provided as a notifyObject created 13-Feb-2007 10:39:41

Returns:
the exception to throw

ping

public void ping(boolean rethrowInterruptedExceptions)
          throws SmartFrogLivenessException,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException
Handle pings by rethrowing any caught exception. There is special handling for InterruptedException, as it is often raised when stopping a thread. It may not be an error for that to have happened.

Parameters:
rethrowInterruptedExceptions - should an InterruptedException be wrapped as a liveness failure.
Throws:
SmartFrogLivenessException - containing any wrapped exception
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a remote exception was caught

run

public void run()
Runs the execute() method, catching any exception it throws and storing it away for safe keeping After the run, the notify object is notified

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

execute

public void execute()
             throws java.lang.Throwable
If this thread was constructed using a separate Runnable run object, then that Runnable object's run method is called. If this thread was constructed using a separate Executable run object, then that Executable object's execute method is called; otherwise, this method does nothing and returns.

Subclasses of should override this method.

Specified by:
execute in interface Executable
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - if anything went wrong

waitForNotification

public boolean waitForNotification(long timeout)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Block on the notify object and so wait until the thread is finished.

Parameters:
timeout - timeout in milliseconds
Returns:
true if we are now finished
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the execution was interrupted

ping

public static void ping(SmartFrogThread thread)
                 throws SmartFrogLivenessException,
                        java.rmi.RemoteException
Ping the thread parameter if it is not null. A null thread is not treated as a liveness failure.

Parameters:
thread - thread to ping, may be null
Throws:
SmartFrogLivenessException - if the thread raises it
java.rmi.RemoteException - if the thread raises it
